document.docAuthor: Marinoni, Luciane, Steyskal, George C. & Knutson, Lloyd
document.masterDocTitle: Revision and cladistic analysis of the Neotropical Genus Thecomyia Perty (Diptera: Sciomyzidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision and cladistic analysis of the Neotropical Genus Thecomyia Perty (Diptera: Sciomyzidae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Thecomyia limbata
.
Frey, 1918
: 24
[generic combination].­
Hendel, 1932
: 98
[suggested synonym with
Thecomyia longicornis
].­
Abercrombie and Berg, 1975
: 355
­368 [biology and description of immature stages].­
Knutson et al., 1976
: 13
[Neotropical catalog].

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type specimens
. Described from three males in the Humboldt University Museum, Berlin. George Steyskal examined the male holotype on
16 Apr 1968
, and according to his notes, the specimen is labeled: 1 . Green label, “ Brasil v. Olfers”, “ 2575 ”, 2 . Red label, “ Typus ”, 3 . Green label, “limbatus m.”, “Tetan. limbata Wied. ”, “Thecom. Longicornis Perty ”. Steyskal further noted, “wing, 6.53 mm . long = # 1 in my key. F 2 (only middle leg present) without medial bri”. Steyskal did not indicate whether or not he examined the male genitalia.

Biology .
Abercrombie and Berg ( 1975 )
reared this species through its complete life cycle, starting with larvae, puparia, and adults that were collected in Rio de Janeiro and São Vicente , Brazil . They described all immature stages. The larvae are rather typical predators of freshwater, non­operculate snails.
